task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 346°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: The current pitch is 0°, so the building's roof may not be visible; rotating upward will reveal the full structure for height estimation.
The current upward pitch shows the roof but not the base; rotating downward will reveal the ground level to measure the full height from base to roof.
Having observed both the roof (at +30° pitch) and base (at -30° pitch), the building spans approximately 60° vertically; assuming a typical distance of ~9m, the height is estimated as 10 meters.
